article_title: CIMB to Raise $1.1 Billion in Placement
article_text:
SINGAPORE—Malaysian lender CIMB Group Holdings is seeking to sell shares in the bank that may raise as much as $1.1 billion—the biggest fundraising in Southeast Asia so far this year.

The country's second-largest bank by assets will sell as many as 500 million shares between 7.10 Malaysian ringgit and 7.25 ringgit ($2.18-$2.23) each. That...

twitter.description: Malaysian bank will use the proceeds for expansion, reducing borrowings and for working capital

article_metadata.article.origheadline: CIMB to Raise $1.1 Billion in Placement

article_summary:
SINGAPORE—Malaysian lender CIMB Group Holdings is seeking to sell shares in the bank that may raise as much as $1.1 billion—the biggest fundraising in Southeast Asia so far this year.
The country's second-largest bank by assets will sell as many as 500 million shares between 7.10 Malaysian ringgit and 7.25 ringgit ($2.18-$2.23) each.
